Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kkoep
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and have stayed here multiple times. It's a smaller hotel, with smaller rooms (but very clean and comfortable) and all of the staff is wonderful and very helpful. It's located on a lively street in the heart of the city (if you don't like the noise, ask for a room on the side street) and the rooms have balconies, so it's great to look out over the city. I have recommended it to all of my friends and now everyone I know stays here and loves it. You can't go wrong with the price or the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Madrid accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Ten22
Reviews.Content: Clean, affordable and right in the heart of Madrid. Walking distance to madrid's most famous tapas markets and streets. We were very happy with our accommodation choice. Will definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Old Fashioned Hotel in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Karen Y
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent four days in Madrid and absolutely loved this place. Although the rooms were small, they were very clean, the beds were comfortable, and we had a nice little balcony. The bathroom was spotless, too. The only "complaint" would be that it's right in the middle of everything, so it's pretty noisy at night outside. Don't plan on actually getting to sleep until about 2am. However, it's pretty quiet in the mornings. We happened to be there during the soccer match between Spain and Italy (Spain won, so you could imagine the days of noise that followed). The owners were wonderful and very accommodating, despite the language barriers. We got really good at charades! Highly recommended if you're looking for a clean, friendly establishment in the middle of it all. Close to the Sol Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “super location charming local Hostal”
Reviews.Author: gerry r
Reviews.Content: basic but very charmiong old fashioned hotel. Staff very friendly although english limited but that adds to the charm. The location really could not be better to sample Madrid life, Plaza Mayor and San Miguel market place are really buzzing. The Emma Cafe/restaurant around the corner was our favourite but you will be spoiled for choice of good value eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Kellispec
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this little hostal. Stayed for 5 nights and will definitely be back. It is small but spotlessly clean and located in an amazing part of the city. Riccardo at the front desk (he may be the proprietor) did not speak a lot of English but we communicated well and he was a doll--so helpful. I paid 68 Euros for a double room (it was two weeks ago, in November). Highly recommend this little place. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Pulito e modesto, assolutamente consigliato!”
Reviews.Author: siicorretto
Reviews.Content: Nice to stay, quite and very clean. Two major issues: 1) a bit far away from the subway although in the most central area of Madrid. 2) breakfast not included in a already quite average price

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkFozzy
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel beside Plaza Mayor. You will need earplugs though as the area is busy throughout the night plus the internal walls are paper thin. Rooms are small but perfectly satisfactory and the ones with a balcony are excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: fastturtle
Reviews.Content: Great location and great room. Bathroom was large and clean with soap, shampoo and hairdryer provided. Reception was very friendly even though they had to use Google translator. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, no A/C... only a ceiling fan...”
Reviews.Author: jhallare
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great location for the cost/night. Ricardo, the owner of the hostal, was very responsive and booking by e-mail went without a hitch. I also e-mailed him a couple logistic questions after making the booking and he responded to each inquiry within 24 hrs. Like most of the reviews have mentioned, the location is perfect, you are pretty much steps away from Plaza Mayor (literally, you go up these steps and you're there), Puerta del Sol, and Cava Baja and Cava Alta, which are pretty much where all the restaurants and tapas bars are. My brother and I also found this great market called Mercado de San Miguel, which was great for tapas or dinner near the hostal. CONS: There was no A/C in our room, only a dinky ceiling fan which only spread the hot air. As we went around the end of June, it was extremely hot and I couldn't sleep. It was the worst part of our trip but it was probably my fault for not making sure that the room was airconditioned. It was also advertised that there would be wifi but the first night we were there, the wifi was out. After I told Ricardo, he fixed it the next day. Also, I am not an awesome Spanish speaker but I'm not horrible either and we were able to pretty much communicate well enough with Ricardo and the other hostal staff but some nights, my Spanish would be worse off and it was a struggle to let them know what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money. great location to walk anywhere in madrid central.”
Reviews.Author: smokee2
Reviews.Content: If you want to be part of the after 8pm nightlife and all the sounds and smells of people eating drinking and going places then get a room with a balcony. If not a room at the rear is quieter. Loved the old style lift and genuine spanish friendly service. Very clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: SeafoodQueen
Reviews.Content: As previously mentioned, this hostal has an excellent location - plenty of bars and restaurants on the doorstep, 5-10 minutes walk from the metro and within walking distance of many of the sights of Madrid. The room was very small, but spotlessly clean with a good shower. It overlooked a lightwell, which meant it was a bit dark in the morning, but that we weren't bothered by street noise. Booking by email was efficient and friendly. Would stay again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Mofcarter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights. We intended on only two and stuck around for 4. It was the perfect central location with decent rooms and great prices. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Definite recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: bigeck13
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had visited madrid, we saw the hostal la macarena on our first trip and immediately knew we wanted to book it on our return. The location is second to none, right beside Plaza Mayor, 2 minutes from calle de cava baja where the best tapas bars are. You have to book directly with the hotel through the website, we payed 69 euros per night, that was paying cash, it was 79 euros if you used a card, we didn't know this so we had to get more money from the bank. staff very friendly, they don't speak much english but we managed to get by. Nothing bad to say about this place and will definately be booking again when we return to madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: joensy191
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hostels in Europe and South America and received the worst treatment I have ever gotten at this hostel. My friend was due to arrive a day after me (which I told them in advance... and they confirmed) but when I went to pay, they charged me for a double fo the first night. When telling the owner and another staff member that I was being overcharged they laughed in my face, told me I was wrong, embarassed me in front of other guests, and were completely rude. They were not helpful at any other point during the stay, they did not have any good recommendations and did not have any information for my friend and I about the city of Madrid. Also, one of the main rreasons we chose the hostel in the first place was because they promised free internet and comptuer access however the internet was not working throughout our entire stay. The staff was awful and ruined an otherwise great stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal location + fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: egtravel
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: La Macarena couldn't be in a better location in central Madrid -- literally around the corner from Plaza Mayor, down the block from La Botin, the world's oldest restaurant, within easy walking distance to Plaza Oriente, Plaza Real, Opera, Sol, and an enjoyable brisk jaunt to the museums (Prado, Reina Sofia), fountains (Cibeles, Neptune), and Retiro Park. You feel the energy of the city and have the benefit of being at the center of all the action. If you forget something, need another layer, or want to drop off something you bought, chances are you're not far from your room and can easily return without it being an inconvenient sacrifice of time. SERVICE: the 2 people we dealt with at Macarena were both incredibly friendly, helpful, kind and accomodating. They gave us a choice of a room with or without a balcony, asked if they could hold our bags for the day when we had to check out in the morning but didn't leave until later that evening, and offered advice and help with good restaurants, sights, plazas, museums, etc. (even offering to make reservations!). This is really what makes this hostal so worth staying at - such great people! OTHER NOTES: the rooms with balconies are wonderful for getting a nice breeze and looking out on the street but significantly louder than the inside rooms; the inside rooms are nice and quiet but get little natural light. Our shower was very small, but not a huge deal. Paid about 69 Euros/night over the weekend, which was a good deal in comparison with the many others we looked at. I'm happy to answer any questions about Macarena if you'd like more info, and have a great time in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: JaneYost
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Spain on a whim, traveling there within 10 days of booking it .... all in June! How crazy was that? But our daughter was spending 6 weeks there on a study abroad, and, well ....... we wanted to go too! So it was with some degree of surprise and delight that we realized what a gem of a hotel we managed to book, considering that the entire old city of Madrid was basically booked out by the time we made our arrangements. First the location ... it was right by the Chuchilleros gate to the Plaza Mayor ... in the most delightful little street, full of restaurants, and most notably, the most ancient restaurant/bars in the city that are embedded in the Plaza Mayor structure itself. This does not mean that it was noisy and rowdy out there in the street, the Spanish do eat late, but they're not an unruly bunch. The room we had was extremely small, but then we were only there for 3 nights (we broke our stay in Madrid up into 2 visits, with a trip to Valencia in between). There wasn't a lot of room for movement around the bed ... and our particular room had the tall shutter style windows that opened onto a central "courtyard" of sorts ... pretty typical of some of the very old European apartment style buildings. Another setback with some of these places is the lack of true air conditioning, however, we did have a ceiling fan, which made our nights bearable at the very least. I remember reading reviews about the air conditioning issue in some of these old Madrid hostels (small hotels with reception on 2nd floor) back in 2007 just before we went ... and of course everyone has different thresholds for discomfort, so some of the reviews posted made places like this look horrifyingly uncomfortable ... while others said it wasn't an issue. We were there in mid-summer, and it was fine. But then again, we're reasonably fit people for our age with no major health issues. Things like this should be taken into consideration, our particular room at this type of hotel could be uncomfortable for some. Hostal La Macarena is located on Cava de San Miguel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy building, shifty staff”
Reviews.Author: mjax520
Reviews.Content: While the location is great, the downside is that it's only one flight above the street which means that restaurant/bar/drunk activity keeps going until 2-3 am and then the trash trucks rumble by an hour later. In other words, it's hard to get a good night's sleep here. Rooms are nice, though we were promised a double bed and had only two singles. That too would have been fine, except after agreeing up front for a cheaper price they wrote the bill with a higher price, and played dumb when we were leaving for the airport. I don't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: grumpylamp
Reviews.Content: Just outside the Plaza Mayor. Terrific location. Our room was quiet, clean, nice flat screen TV, free internet on their machine. Near markets for snacks and cafes for tapas So glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, No Frills Hostal”
Reviews.Author: marcusandgriffin
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Macarena in November. It is a no frills, but friendly hostal in a good location. When I first arrived I was tired & thought the Macarena was a bit grim. Over the three days the Macarena grew on me, mainly because the staff are warm and friendly. The rooms are basic, but clean. Since it is low season, I was able to pick my room. The rooms in the front have charming old french door type windows with shutters that open onto mini-balconies above a small square. I imagine these rooms can be noisy in summer (it was quite cold so no one was sitting outside at the bars on the street). The rooms in the back face onto an internal "air shaft" so they would be quiet, but not bright. The rooms are painted peach, and were being freshly painted while I was there. The "superior" room in the back had the nicest bathroom & was larger. There is a common living room with free internet for guests. My only complaints were that my room was quite cold (those charming french-door windows are drafty) & the walls are a bit thin. Note, when I said something about the heat, the man at the desk came in to take a look & the room got slightly warmer. Nonetheless, if you go in winter take warm clothes! Overall, I got the sense that the owners care about the place, and want to make their guests comfortable. The hostal is just a few blocks up from a great stretch of tapas bars on Cava Baja, and a short walk from El Rastro. It is a 15 min. walk to the Prado & Reina Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pierre-jambon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Macarena is a simple family run hotel located in a very conveniently opposite Plaza Mayor. Our room is facing Cava San Miguel with a little balcony. Initially I have reservations if this will be too noisy, but I was pleasantly suprised the noise from the restaurant below do not bother us at all. If it does, the room has a sound proof door. I like the liveliness around the area as I consider this part of my experience living in a pack old town. The hotel is very well manage. Our room, bathroom and common areas are spotless. Jose from the front desk is always available if you have a question and is a fountain of knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Macarena in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Polter
Reviews.Content: La Macarena is a modest small hostal hotel, located 100 steps from the Plaza Mayor in downtown Madrid on the second floor of a large apartment building (with elevator) on a busy restaurant and tapa bar street. About a 10 minute walk to the Puerta del Sol and its Sol Metro stop, or 10 minutes to the Opera Metro stop. Macarena has a very helpful staff with 24/7 front desk service. Some English spoken by most of the staff. We had a small room with a double bed, nice roomy private bath with tub and shower and cable TV. No meals available at Macarena but ample nearby spots for any type food. Back rooms are quiet, front rooms may be a bit noisy facing Cava de San Miguel street. There is a common room with wide screen TV, library books and free internet service. No printer so you can check in for flights but cannot print boarding passes. We paid 74 Euros and consider this a real bargain. A/C and telephones available in all rooms. Macarena is across the street from the renown Casa Botin restaurant, a must for visitors and locals alike. You can also find interesting tapa bars along Cava de San Miguel, one of which specializes in sizzling stuffed mushrooms and live keyboard music. Local red wine (tinto de la casa) costs about $2 a glass in these bars. While the Plaza Mayor is scenic and photogenic, food and drink at the outdoor cafes is hugely expensive. Enjoy walking around the plaza but do your eating and drinking in carefully chosen bars and restaurants nearby. Most post menus outside with prices for window shopping your choices. Look for locals inside for indications of good food and fair prices. Seniors be sure to ask for senior discounts for entry to sites having entry fees. Some do, some don't. For example, the double decker city tour bus costs 16 Euros, seniors pay 8.50 Es. Macarena is not luxury, but it is a fine choice at a very reasonable price in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, little decor”
Reviews.Author: memphistraveler77
Reviews.Content: As others have commented, the rooms are small and lacking in decor, but the value is good and the location is perfect. We booked directly with them via email and had no trouble with our reservations. Our room was comfortable and clean. Our windows opened onto a light well so it was fairly quiet. This is not a luxurious place at all, but the staff was very nice to us. The hostal is located up two flights of stairs but their is an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: andy_scot_uk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its price and location to the city centre. We were very very pleased with its location right off the plaza Mayor, just round the corner from the old town hall and 5 mins from Sol and its nightlife. The rooms had fans on the ceiling ( 219) which provided air conditioning. The rooms were very small but cleaned every day. For the price and location this was acceptable to me. On arrival its difficult to find the entrance - you have the press the buzzer on what looks like a residential black door next to the restaurant. Then climb two floors to reception. There are no signs or directions to tell you this.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Angelica_Demon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing it in the Rough Guide handbook as a reasonable place to stay whilst in Madrid. I was aware that they were a small family run outfit but looked forward to being right by the Plaza Mayor, the centre of all in the city we wanted to see. Booked the room wasn't too hard, we called and asked for an English speaker and seemed to be able to communicate enough to book the room, we also received a confirmation e-mail reiterating that we had requested a quiet room (we had heard the hotel was on a noisy road). When we arrived, we were a little confised as the hostal is inside a residential apartment block so we had to buzz to get in, and then pop up to the second floor in a little lift. The owner of the hostal (we presume as he was always there pretty much!) greeted us and pointed us along the corridor to our room. If i'm honest I was a little disappointed as we were in a tiny room. It was just a double bed, and two bedside cabinets touching either way, a little bathroom with stall shower and a small fitted wardrobe. The pictures I saw on here were of much larger rooms, and so we asked if they had any larger rooms avaliable but were told they were all much the same size. one of the wrost parts was our view was of a tiny interior 'courtyard' which was just a mass of rubbish and pipes. If we'd stood on the balcony we could have almost touched the opposite wall! This meant the whole of our stay, the room was cloaked in darkness with no natural light and we couldn't open the 'shutter' type exterior blind or everyone in the opposing rooms would be able to see in. As a plus though - our room was quieter than I imagine the street facing ones with a nice view are. I was really upset the day we checked in as there are speakers in the ceiling of the corridor leading away from reception blaring out pop music. Even when we closed the bedroom door, as the speaker was right outside it was still really loud. Bear in mind I'm only 25 and I was bothered by it as I'd had an early flight (we checked in about half eleven am after leaving our house at 5am) and just wanted to chill out. Plus the music seemed to be on loop...grr. We put in some wax earplugs we bought from a chemists on the way out and managed an hour's rest before waking up to go and explore. when we came back at eight p.m, the music was just as loud so thoroughly fed-up, we went out for dinner. I will say in the hotel's defence that although the music continued to a degree for the rest of 5 days we were there, it was never as loud again and could easily be blocked out by shutting the door. Positives of the hotel: The televisions - it only had BBC World, CNBC and CNN for English speakers but they are lovely flat-screens which is better than in any cheap hotel I've had in Spain before. The location - you literally could walk to everywhere you want to go in the city-sentre from Gran Via, the Museum, the Retiro, Sol, The Rastro and of course, Plaza Mayor. The El Botin restaurant, the oldest in Europe, is almost opposite and the best paellas in Madrid at La Barraca are a short walk. Cleaniless - The room was cleaned everyday whilst we were out, and to a much higher standard than you would expect at a small hotel. We always had clean towels and a hairdryer in the bathroom was an unexpected bonus!! Comfortable beds - I will say that being English, we were used to a standard double bed but our American couterparts would be disappointed at the size of the beds as they are used to at least Queen-size. Negatives - Size of rooms - honestly ours (220) was tiny, even for us who are two small people. Noise - despite the fact we couldn't hear the street, the actual hotel is noisy due to thin walls between rooms, water rushing through pipes, people living upstairs and cleaners clattering around at 9am. Night-time - As this is in residential building, you have to buzz to get in. At 2am after acting like a true Madrileno and scoping our the local bars, you feel a little like you are intruding. The night porter (usually a really friendly non-English speaking lady) has to switch the corridor lights on to show you to your room. Personally we quite liked the 'homely' feel of this, but at the same time you feel like naughty schoolkids....! Price - With I.V.A our room was 79EUR a night. I'm sure that we could get cheaper with bigger rooms had we gone further away from Plaza Mayor.... One other point is that none of the staff actually speak English to a standard whereby you could convese with them easily. I never expect people to know Ebglish fluently but they must see hundreds of English speaking tourists a year but could still only say the odd word. I would extend this comment to the rest of Madrid in fact. As opposed to trip to Barcelona last year where we ordered everything in Spanish, and they spoke back in English - In Madrid, we attempted Spanish but affirmed we were English if we didn't know the exact words for what we were trying to say but they continued to talk to us in Spanish - and not slowly either!! From one POV this is good as you get a lot of practice in, from another it is difficult as you don't always get what you actually wanted and god knows what would ahppen if you were in trouble!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Laddoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and booked by emailing hostal directly. In total agrement with other reviewers - can't beat the location. And there's a fab cafe at the bottom of the street that stays open into the night, v handy for chilling out after a long day on the streets. Loved the proximity to Plaza Mayor, and indulged in touristy flamenco show and restuarant just 10m away from the front door because it was raining on our last night! The Metro was very convenient (Sol). The staff were helpful, and kept our luggage in a corridor on the last day so we could wander around Madrid freely. However, the rooms are just plain small, and we had a dreary view of a dark alley above a restaurant, so our room often smelled of grease. And there was a huge hole in the bathroom floor that wasn't quite covered up by the bin! Bring your own toiletries and products as this isn't pamper-heaven. However, the bed was comfortable and extra pillows were provided. Staff were pleasant. But, I probably won't be staying here again, as this is definitely not somewhere I recommend for easy-going young folk who may not be the quietest bunch. The walls must be made of paper! So little soundproofing! So, don't stay here if you are likely to want to talk to other people in your room after 10pm, for fear of causing offence to other guests! Might be better off staying in a bigger chain hotel up on Grand Via with thicker bedroom walls!

Reviews.Title: “great intimate place for the family”
Reviews.Author: wetakethekids
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 days in hostal la macarena - 2 triple rooms (small, the three large twin beds crammed together spanned the length of the room, with our own baths, wardrobe and small desk) and sparkling clean. went with kids (5 and 2) and grandparents and split 2 adjoining rooms. the location is excellent; up a flight of steps to plaza mayor. we had requested inside rooms and even on the saturday night we were there, it was completely quiet even though there was commotion outside til 2-3am. ricardo and his staff were very friendly. communication was by email. we saw the balcony rooms, and they were very cute, overlooking a small square and cobblestoned one lane street. this is not a big hotel chain; it feels more like a bed and breakfast type place; situated on the second floor of an old apt complex (with the european style tiny elevators) with the other floors being residential. it's small; don't expect room service and big hotel stuff, but it's intimate, very friendly, (some english speaking staff), it'smanned 24/7 by the front desk staff and was 90euros for each triple room with a great location! excellent tapas and chocolat con churros nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CuthbertJ
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a perfect location. Some of the best tapas and restaurants are on Calle Cava Baja, which is two minutes away. You can walk to all museums as well. The only problem which is common to all old hotels in Spain is the noise from other rooms. The staff is nice but they may pull the old, "our credit card machine is broken we need cash". I would stay here again though because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at la Macarena”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbelle7
Reviews.Content: My friend & i shared a double here a couple of weeks ago for a total of 8 nights, and we couldn't be much happier with our choice, in this price range. Only downside, is the rooms are very small...even compared to typical bite-size budget hotel rooms found across europe. If you can get past that, this place has a lot to offer: Location could not be better... it's right off one of the best streets in madrid in my opinion--some of the most authentic restaurants are nearby (including Botin, literally across the street), entrance to plaza mayor also right across the street, shops, walkable to main "tourist" sites and neighborhoods you'll want to see as a visitor, and just an all-around charming, fun spot. Our room had a balcony facing the street, but remarkably the shutters/doors drowned out most of the street noise at night. Staff were great--friendly, responsive, helpful. Hostal is well-maintained, kind of homey & charming, and very clean. Reception desk was manned 24/7 during our stay, and perhaps best of all-- free internet on their house computer. Our room also had a nice flatscreen tv with satellite svc. Not sure if they have a/c, but it was pleasant in early june. I'd recommend this place and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: woodsrule
Reviews.Content: A lovely hostal in a great location. Rooms are small but have everything you need, staff are lovely and the location brilliant. It will pass the mother inspection too! I plan to take my 70 y.o mother with me next time my husband & I visit Madrid and stay at Hostal Macarena.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - A Little Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mectraveler
Reviews.Content: The best things about the Hostal La Macarena were the location and the staff. Located just behind the Plaza Mayor, the hotel is within easy walking distance to the Puerta del Sol, the Palacio Real, and many fine restaurants and shops. It is also a long walk or short metro ride to the Prado. The staff is wonderful. They helped us with any needs that we had - even allowing us to use the computer at the checkin desk to quickly check email. The only downside is the noise from within the hotel. While we had a room overlooking the street, the ability to close the windows and the shutters drowned out most of the noise (the only thing we could really hear from outside was the strolling accordian player - which was kind of nice). However, we had a room near the front desk and could clearly hear every conversation, phone ring, and door bell. The walls are a little thin and I could hear the person snoring and coughing in the room next to me. All in all, for a couple of nights it is a good hotel fo the money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: keagan
Reviews.Content: Though the staff does not speak much English, I managed to book this over the phone, and in person they were very tolerant of my terrible Spanish. The hotel is in a great location just down the stairs from Plaza Mayor. Our room was decent enough with two double beds that we pushed together, cable TV, and a private bathroom. My only issue was that we were there in a heat wave and the hotel has no AC, but I believe there was a ceiling fan. For the price it was fine. Side note: on the walk from the subway you walk by a falafel and fries place. It is the best falafel I have ever had, and the fries were great too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hostal”
Reviews.Author: stoffer
Reviews.Content: Hostal La Macarena (--) is great value. Situated veru close to Plaza Mayor on a quiet street on the second floor. The rooms are small -but clean and some are with a balcony. It is clean and the staff are very friendly - speaks a little english. Learn some spanish words it will help. We payed 64 euros a night - we will stay here next time too.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Nightmare place, avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As professionals from the States we travel a lot but la Macarena was the worst hotel experience in our life. We stayed only for one night and the next morning at 6:30 a.m. we had to take a plane to a conference in Cairo. We contacted the hotel from the States making sure they can provide us with a taxi. We got an e-mail assuring us that it would be no problem. The morning of the flight we waited on the street with our luggage and after some time we went back to the hotel to find out that they FORGOT about calling the taxi while assuring us all was okay the day before!!! We were about to miss our flight, there was no taxi around and they showed absolutely no interest to help and on top of everything they were rude. Till today they take no responsibility for what had happened and they never admitted that it was their fault. We made it to the airport in the last moment by stopping a private car and convincing the driver to take us there. Tremendous stress, horrible experience! Hotel is more than a bed and a bathroom, it is resposibility of the management for the guests welfare. La Macarena shows none. Stay away from this hotel, you do not know what can happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fricodam
Reviews.Content: Room for three (triple) was so small that hardly can accommodate one person. We changed the room for double –it was twice bigger then triple, but had a funky smell from the bathroom. I left my face cream in the bathroom, concierge denied she ever seen it. If you are on the budget you can find nicer, bigger and chipper place. I wouldn’t stay there again, although the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal La Macarena”
Reviews.Author: avery99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, Nov 9 & 10. The location was great and the rooms were clean. The staff was nice. The rooms were VERY small to the point that we had to walk over the bed due to our suitcases. The bed was pretty comfortable. I am not sure that I would stay here again but I also wasn't too fond of Madrid so we probably wouldn't go back to the city. I much preferred the rest of Spain to Madrid, which is what we expected. We did enjoy our very short stay though and I would highly recommend the Reina Sofia museum. We loved the Guernica exhibit.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, nice and central”
Reviews.Author: jdt4242
Reviews.Content: Really nice place, pretty simple but really clean, most of the rooms have balconies with beautiful views onto the street. Excellent location, right in the middle of things, and lots to see and do all around. Watch out because there's no air con though - in October it was lovely but in summer I imagine it gets pretty stuffy. The bathrooms were simple but clean and functional, all in all a really good budget option, not luxury but would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “**Nothing beats La Macarena in its class**”
Reviews.Author: Michiel2Anne
Reviews.Content: La Macarena is located on a prime location right in the center of historical Madrid. If you walk across the street you are at 'Plaza Mayor' filled with (touristic) bars and restaurants. If you walk down the street to 'Cava Baja' you find Madrid's authentic restaurants and bars. The rooms are small but charming, very clean and have all the facilities that you need. If you look at price, rooms and location, nothing beats La Macarena! I have studied in Madrid for 6 months and have stayed in a lot of hotels/hostals in the price range between 50-75 euros for a double room. La Macarena is definitively the best in its class.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a great location, at a great price, at a wonderful, clean place, this is IT. The hostal's people were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were of adequate size, very clean (especially the bathrooms). The only drawback is the absence of air conditioning. Best time of year to go would probably be autumn, spring, or winter. Our days during the summer were not so bad - we opened our windows and went to bed in the wee-hours of the morning to avoid the noise from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really clean”
Reviews.Author: GreenofNewark
Reviews.Content: Bit apprehensive about booking into a hostal, but had read previous reviews on TA and thought I would give it a go. Good choice - excellent location, right next to Plaza Mayor - bars and cafes close by. Hostal itself was amazingly clean. Three of us shared a room which was cosy, but not cramped. Fan in room rather than air conditioning. Noise from street bars outside later in evening, but soon solved by being out later ourselves! Would definately recommend for the price.

Reviews.Title: “La Macarena: Great Location! Fair Cost! Clean! Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: VadaliaSpeaks
Reviews.Content: Hostal La Macarena, adjacent to the Plaza Mayor at #8 Cava de San Miguel, is a sparkling-clean family-run hostal (don't let the word "hostal" keep you away - in Spain, it means a small hotel.) La Macarena has full-size rooms, each with private bath. Rooms are nicely decorated, with firm, comfortable beds, satellite TV, air-conditioning, and telephone. Although facing a party street of bars and restaurants, rooms have thick walls and shutters on either side of the windows, so noise is not a problem. We stayed at La Macarena twice in April, 2005. Two different rooms - room 210, where we spent nine nights, has a small balcony overlooking the Cava de San Miguel; room 214 (2 nights) has a small sun room with seating, overlooking a small square where a movie was being filmed. It is a short walk to Puerto del Sol, Grand Via, the Metro or the Royal Palace. We even strolled to the Prado Museum, with ease. Cost 57 Euro per night, based on a 9-day stay. Definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Initial traffic anxiety left us on arrival, once we got the car close to the hostal ! Our navigation problem, not the Hostal. Excellent location - smallish but clean and comfortable double room with all systems working and daily service very good. Jose was a real plus and quietly very helpful. Location suited to the tourist and Hostal provided very good value for the friendly and efficient service and level of accommodation offered. Others paying much more had no better facilities, poorer location, no friendly and helpful atmosphere and missed the excitement of the immediate area. The Hostal is so close to but just far enough away from the worst of the potential tourist traps. La Macarena entirely lived up to the rap given it by The Lonely Planet. Courteous and prompt responses were provided to accommodation queries and requests prior to us making our booking.

Reviews.Title: “Saludos a Jose!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Macarena for 5 nights in May 2005. The hotel room was small, but very clean. It is located a couple steps away from Plaza Mayor, and about 3 minute walk to Puerta del Sol. Other tourist spots close by are El Palacio Real (about 8 min walk) and El Parque Del Moro (behind El Palacio Real). The hotel is comfortable, but Jose at the front desk makes the whole experience even better. If you are traveling in a tight budget, this is the best place to stay at.
